resistance is unknown but could include:
, post-insulin receptor (signaling) defect
, elevated levels of free fatty acids

glucose dependent tissues
(skeletal muscle, liver,
adipocytes) are unable
to take up glucose

sends signals
to liver to increase
gluconeogenesis and
glycogenolysis

glucose tolerance
is initially normal because
beta cells compensate by
fr insulin production =
hyperinsulinemia

leads to down regulation

responsible
for symptoms and chronic complications of diabetes

, fasting glucose> 126 mg/dL
, elevated HbA 1 c

excess serum
glucose exceeds
renal threshold

nephropathy: glomerulosclerosis
, microalbuminuria, proteinuria, chronic renal failure (see map)

neuropathy: gastroparesis
, orthostatic hypotension
, stocking glove paresthesias
